FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to define unfair discrimination in the business of insurance. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 58-11-55 be amended to read as follows: 58-11-55. No insurer shall may refuse to issue or to renew a policy or certificate solely because of the age, residence, race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, occupation, or marital status of the applicant or the insured according to such rules and regulations as promulgated by the director of the Division of Insurance . Except as provided by § 58-15-45, notwithstanding any other provision of this title, this section applies to all types of insurance issued by all insurers. The director may promulgate rules for the purpose of carrying out this section. The rules may include definition of terms, identification of specific underwriting or nonrenewal guidelines used by insurers which would violate or be in compliance with this section, and application practices which violate this section. In considering the adoption of any rule pursuant to this section the director shall consider how the rule may serve to implement the purpose of preventing unfair discrimination as prohibited by this section and how the rule may impact the availability and price of insurance in this state. Violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. BILL HISTORY January 14 - First read in House and referred to Commerce. H.J. 31 January 21 - Scheduled for hearing. January 21 - Passed as amended, PASSED, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 73 January 21 - Placed on Consent.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to define unfair discrimination in the business of insurance. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 58-11-55 be amended to read as follows: 58-11-55. No insurer shall may refuse to issue or to renew a policy or certificate solely because of the age, residence, race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, occupation, or marital status of the applicant or the insured according to such rules and regulations as promulgated by the director of the Division of Insurance . An insurer may use age in determining whether to issue or renew life, health, or annuity policies. An insurer may use occupation in determining whether to issue or renew a life or disability policy. Except as provided by § 58-15-45, this section applies to all types of insurance issued by all insurers under Title 58. The director may promulgate rules for the purpose of carrying out this section. The rules may include definition of terms, identification of general practices or nonrenewal guidelines used by insurers which would violate or be in compliance with this section, and application practices which violate this section. In considering the adoption of any rule pursuant to this section the director shall consider how the rule may serve to implement the purpose of preventing unfair discrimination as prohibited by this section and how the rule may impact the availability and price of insurance in this state. Violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. BILL HISTORY 1/14/97 First read in House and referred to Commerce. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to define unfair discrimination in the business of insurance. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 58-11-55 be amended to read as follows: 58-11-55. No Except as provided in sections 2 and 3 of this Act, no insurer shall may refuse to issue or to renew a policy or certificate solely because of the age, residence, race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, occupation, or marital status of the applicant or the insured according to such rules and regulations as promulgated by the director of the Division of Insurance . Violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. An insurer may use age in determining whether to issue or renew life, health, or annuity policies. An insurer may use occupation in determining whether to issue or renew a life or disability policy. Section 3. Except as provided by § 58-15-45 and section 2 of this Act, § 58-11-55 applies to all types of insurance issued by all insurers under Title 58. However, nothing in § 58-11-55 may be construed as applying to or affecting the right of any fraternal benefit society subject to chapter 58-37A to determine its eligibility requirements for membership or be construed as applying to or affecting the offering of benefits exclusively to members or persons eligible for membership in the society by a subsidiary corporation or an affiliated organization of the society. Section 4. The director may promulgate rules for the purpose of preventing unfair discrimination pursuant to § 58-11-55. The rules may include definition of terms, identification of general practices or nonrenewal guidelines used by insurers which would violate or be in compliance with § 58-11-55, and application practices which violate § 58-11-55. In considering the adoption of any rule pursuant to this section, the director shall consider how the rule may serve to implement the purpose of preventing unfair discrimination as prohibited by § 58-11-55 and how the rule may impact the availability and price of insurance in this state.
